did.abstract: A series of six letters from Tom [Grier?] of Boston, Mass. to Ella B. Clarke of Peoria, Ill. The letters primarily reflect the couples' courtship as Grier expresses his affection for Ella Clarke and as he discusses their wedding plans. Grier's letters also describe aspects of amusements and social life in Boston, especially concerts. To a lesser extent, he also writes about his work for Grier & Co., a grain shipping business. The letters seemingly indicate that Grier's family resided in Peoria, Illinois.
